website_summaries.verdict: This is a good choice if you're looking for a powerful drill that isn't limited by the length of a cord.
pros: Easily detach the drill head and swap in another compatible tool attachment
LED lights show you how much charge is left
Won't overheat when used for long periods at a time
cons: Some users don't feel that the handle is particularly comfortable or ergonomic

customer_reviews.title: Decent drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice drill. You can purchase other snap-in devices for it, like the impact driver, etc. It comes with the small battery, but there are bigger ones you can purchase, that fit it, if you need greater capacity. The main reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is because it only has one speed. There is no fast/slow, high/low speed switch. The top speed of the drill bit might be a little slow, if you are looking for a really high speed drilling application. Other than that, great bang for the buck. It works great and the battery lasts a long time, even though it is the smallest one that fits that drill.
customer_reviews.author: James Burkes

customer_reviews.title: Grate for the price! But you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This drill has been amazing so far! Only things I've had an issue with is the batteries don't like extreme cold. When it's 0 or below they don't seam to work at all. But that's a rare extreme. Other than that it's not the strongest drill in the world but it gets the job done! I work apartment maintenance and it does everything I need it to. It will struggle a little with 3 inch wood screws in to a stud but it still gets it done. The impact attachment helps a lot. I highly recommend this as a budget general purpose drill!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.  One of the best drills I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the Craftsman version since apparently Sears bought the rights to this drill for a year. I lost the first one somewhere in my house and ended up getting this one because I still have a few attachments for the first one. I am happy to report that the attachments work and this is an even better drill since the addition of the rare earth magnet bit holder. Even ignoring a versatility of using non-drill attachments, this is an excellent unit for all around drilling (perhaps not hammer drilling). It has just the right amount of heft to it and the key-less chuck does not go bad with use.
customer_reviews.author: Ylushtak

customer_reviews.title: My one an only drill
customer_reviews.text: While I only have the attachment that it comes with, I'm looking forward to nabbing the impact drill attachment. I'm curious about the router attachment as well, but I'm having trouble justifying a $50 price tag. Do note that the battery it came with ended up dying (like, dead dead) a month or so after. Luckily, I had recently owned a B&D cordless trimmer with a 20v battery. It has a lesser maH rating, but it still lasts quite a while between charges. Another thing - it has great torque, imo, but it doesn't seem to have as high rpms as other drills. Maybe it's me?
customer_reviews.author: Stitch

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk
customer_reviews.text: Had this drill and all the parts for years, then that was lost and ordered a new one to replace. It lasted a couple weeks and no love from B&D for replacement, opened it up and found the motor was shot. Got a replacement for that one and it lasted a couple weeks, again no support from B&D, but go the amazon warranty... Those Asurion Protection Plan people are a total scam and won't replace. Stay away from B&D and Asurion just a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: AtSea

customer_reviews.title: Wish they'd go brushless, not high toque reliable
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is I've burnt through 2 of them, older models but very similiar, I'm sure only the vents and led are different. One burnt out drilling a few holes in metal another burnt out drilling a few 2 inch holes in wood, both times it was a very small project that killed them, that required a bit of torque. I have a whole set built up, it is really useful sometimes, just wish they'd build a brushless model for a $100 or something tired of burning up drills. Don't rely on these for high torque
customer_reviews.author: random spaz 219

customer_reviews.title: None better at this price
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago before most of you were born black and decker got sort of a bad rap well I can tell you Black & Decker’s back I bought their hedge trimmer’s just on a lark and it turns out they’re better than the very expensive ones that I somehow managed to destroy and I have aN (expensive )brand new “red” (I’m not gonna use the name) Brushless half inch hammer drill 18 V competitor and I bought this for my son and I am very impressed it easily competes with what I have for anything but the most heavy duty jobs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Black and Decker
customer_reviews.text: I had a Ryobi system before with the different tools but not the interchangeability of the Matrix system. Also I had NiCad batteries which didn't hold a charge well. Wanted to go with Lithium Ion but entry price for Ryobi was too high. Components are reasonably priced, Lithium Ion batteries hold charge forever. It's like a workbench full of power tools at your fingertips. Tool bag is definitely a must have. Add as you go along. 20 volt goes across a huge spectrum of tools. For the DIYer this is perfect. Thanks Black + Decker!
customer_reviews.author: Tim in Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Love this little drill!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lost the dang bit attachment on the top in the back already, bad design you need to hold there for drilling and screwing for leverage. But excellent battery life my mother has a black and decker weedeater that takes the same batteries. Really a win win!!!!! Love it!!!! We have 5 Batteries between her drill and weedeater and my drill!!! And guess what Amazon has the 20 V lithium replacement batteries! Unlike the Craftsman that I had to put to rest because you cant find a 18 volt nickel cad battery for it anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: D Kevin Lanham

customer_reviews.title: You can see sparks!
customer_reviews.text: This drill is awesome! I already had the 20v B&D weeder and blower so now I have 5 batteries to run between the products. It is balanced well, powerful (I had to replace my 24v I had for 15yrs, battery finally died and replacements are 150 bucks+, so I was concerned about power), and the little light feature is kind of cool. Oh and you can pop the drill head off and put other tools on it, like a cutter or a jig, which is also pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Prebo

customer_reviews.title: Don't lose the charger
customer_reviews.text: I like this drill. It's solid and powerful enough for my usage. It comes with such a small 2.0 amp charger I thoght I might lose it, so I put it away in a place where I could find it easily...you guessed it, now I can't find it. I need the drill, but can't use it, so I have to buy another charger. Lowes sells the charger for about $51, The drill costs $56.99 with the charger included, I was tempted to buy another tool just to get the charger. Amazon sells the charger for $31.00, A better deal, but still disproportionately expensive. Upshot: Don't lose the charger.
customer_reviews.author: LorenzoLargo

customer_reviews.title: Fails in 12-15 months and warranty is junk.  (Happened to me twice now)
customer_reviews.text: Product failed after barely any use 15 months after purchase. This the 2nd matrix that has failed me, the 1st being the craftsman version. The 2 year warranty is garbage. Most service centers listed on black and decker website wont even bother looking at it. Others request $35 just to look at it. Could buy a new one for just a fraction more! But, expect it to fail with 15-18 months as well. Avoid!!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: To be continued...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to recently put together an Ikea bed. Now granted, this was only the first project I used this drill on but upon coming to the last step, it somehow only managed to drill 3/8 final screws into the wood and I had to use a manual screw driver for the remainder. I'm hoping to change my opinion and review down the road but seeing as that's the only project I have used it on so far, it will remain a 3 star for the time being. It looks very professional, just was shocked by the first-time performance.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Gehring

customer_reviews.title: Love the tools
customer_reviews.text: I have the drill, circular saw, reciprocating saw, pole saw, and weed eater. I wanted a second drill so that I wouldn't have to constantly switch from drill to bit. I got this one for the versatility and will be ordering the air pump. I also have an adapter that lets me use the batteries from these tools in my old Firestorm jigsaw, and I have a number of batteries. Black and Decker really needs to make a good vacuum ala the Dyson V6 that takes the same batteries. The problem with the Dyson and others is the lack of a swapable battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with it. I’m a small gal and it’s easy for me to use and my boyfriend actually approves of it because it’s stronger than a powered screwdriver, which is what he compared my other one to. I like that I can change it into multiple tools, if I ever need to. Battery seems to hold a charge well and last a long time in use. Can use with other B&D items too!
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Pretty powerful and durrable for a noncommercial drill
customer_reviews.text: This is my second matrix drill. (The last one burned up because I used a 3rd party battery, but it lasted 4 years and several 20ft drops) I can definitely feel the difference between this and an 18v drill. The battery lasts about 3 hours when doing heavy construction (framing and drywall) and 2 days doing light stuff like opening and closing J-boxes. I would recommend anyone who buys this also get the impact driver attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Clam Liquor

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting tool that won't let you down!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the first drill we had. We had our first drill for 5 years before we had to start thinking about buying a new one, the battery life is exceptional, the drill itself is magnificent and in 5 years when this one gets worn down from extreme use I will be purchasing another one. This matrix drill is absolutely amazing in quality and value!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Reece

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost daily for my work as a furniture restorationist, and this was to replace my old stolen Craftsman version of this (Yes, all of B&D's batteries & heads fit the Craftsman & vice-versa with NO problems). It has some minor improvements over the original design as well. While not as strong as something like a DeWalt drill/driver, I've never had any difficulty using it for my work, plus having all the interchangeable tools to connect to the power handle is a huge plus to save on buying many different tools. I even bought the corded version of this B&D Matrix & love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Does its thing so far
customer_reviews.text: Used couple short times. Seems to work well. Have not tried any of the vetting attachments I bought with it yet but did use off brand bit in it and didn't work so well but then went and got brand bit and worked fine... maybe coincidence. So far does what I need but will have to wait and see when I need to use attachments to cut something
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Love These Things!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one because my first one has seen better days. They're not the toughest or fastest 20v drills and tend to smoke when the pressure is on but they are the most versatile. They use the same add-ons as the Craftsman Bolt on that I've used to mix cement with so they seem a bit stronger, if you can find one that's the best of both worlds.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Hawks

customer_reviews.title: Solid, I like it
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit heavy compared to my previous driver (which was admittedly very light), but it's solid and works great once I figured out that the ring at the top of the chuck will adjust the torque levels. Plenty of driving power on the max setting! The weight makes it a bit unwieldy, but would definitely buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas F. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 18 months!
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like this system and bought lots of attachments, oscillating tool, jigsaw, circular saw, and used them all installing new flooring in my bathroom and other little fix ups around the house. Sadly the motor died while making a bookshelf recently. I'm not sure if it's worth buying a new one, if they are easy to die, or if I should buy a craftsman version, or sell all the attachments and buy separate Milwaukee tools for each function.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Swiss Army Knife of drills.
customer_reviews.text: This one tool with its attachments is now my drill, impact driver, circular saw, jigsaw and reciprocating saw. Each has it's limitations but for someone who doesn't do a lot of woodworking they work out fine. Decent power and battery life but buy a 2nd battery just in case a project takes longer than expected.
customer_reviews.author: A Concerned Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the older models
customer_reviews.text: I have an older B&D cordless 18 volt that was so heavy and bulky, I didn't like it. But this one is just the opposite; it's like, more powerful and holds a good charge. Make sure you have it in the drill setting if your testing the torch. If you have it on the number setting, the clutch will slip when you hold the drivers tip with one hand and pull the trigger with your other hand. The feel is good also-not to bulky plus you can but attachments for this model. JUst wish additional batteries wern't so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Navy Boy

customer_reviews.title: This product sucks I bought it last year hardly used it two ...
customer_reviews.text: This product sucks I bought it last year hardly used it two or three times can’t Take any screws off or out because the button gets stuck and now the button is broken and drill only works one way so I spend around 60 to 70$ for this shit. Now it’s too late for me to return this product I have to call the manufacture’ talk to them if they can fix this I would not recommend this product to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite power tool.  Versatile, handy, easy.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for lots of projects. I use the impact driver, jigsaw, and air compressor attachments most. Wish there were more battery options, but they are adequate. The 1.5 AH (stock size) battery works well for small projects. Just need to make sure you have the 4 AH battery for larger projects that will take longer (see pic).
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: just what i needed to use old Craftsman accessories
customer_reviews.text: i have the Craftsman BoltOn system and the driver is dying, which until i found this would have meant all of the money spent on accessories was wasted. (Bolt On product line is no longer made). The B&D Matrix system is same and I can continue to use my old Craftsman batteries and accessories
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G

customer_reviews.title: The real drill
customer_reviews.text: Great drill when you have all the pieces to use, my previous one no longer worked after 5 years of brutal use, which makes this a really good drill. I have used different bits from cutting trees limbs, blind, drilling concrete, wood and metal to evening connecting a snake to my drill bit. It’s worth having one.
customer_reviews.author: Blaqirishman

customer_reviews.title: Great "handy-man" tool system.
customer_reviews.text: This has only one speed but the variable speed control does a good job of maintaining slow speeds. I started out with this 20V system with a yard trimmer and when I found this product I was amazed at the versatility with all the optional attachments. It's not a "professional" level tool, but gives me the ability to have many light duty tools that won't take up half of the work bench. This product and several of its attachments fit nicely in a medium size bin for storage. I can't remember if it came with a battery, but they are easily available here on Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Fox

customer_reviews.title: It holds a charge longer and recharges fastrer than my NiCad battery drills
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to NiCad batteries after using this ion battery one. It is also lighter and smaller and yet the battery lasts so much longer than the NiCad ones and rechaerges faster. The young men that have been helpong me with the garden and yard projects go for this one over the NiCad ones I have. Have to think what to do when those NiCad batteries won't charge up anymore. What do I do with those drills?
customer_reviews.author: animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Good drill. Love the matrix attachments
customer_reviews.text: First power drill. Actually upset that Walmart has the drill and sander bundle for $58. Soooo I was kind of upset it was cheaper than the drill itself. Good drill. Love the matrix attachments. Got the saw and jigsaw attachments and they’re super easy to use. Battery I haven’t tested how long it lasts yet
customer_reviews.author: Justjenny

customer_reviews.title: Best power tool I've ever purchased!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this drill and use it for everything!! Why spend two or three times as mush on a drill that only does one thing?? With this drill, you have so much versatility. I have since bought nearly all available attachments and use it several times a week. I highly recommend this product and would buy it again!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the 1st gen I still have.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have more power than the first gen unit I still use, although that must be close to 7 years old by now and did get a lot of use from it... Magnetic bit holder and the LED light are a bonus. Happy with purchase, own many of the attachments and a corded model too... Great series of tools.
customer_reviews.author: Craig's Garage

customer_reviews.title: Good drill for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the drill. I didn't read into it fully. I just ordered it in a kit with a circular saw. It has a removable drill end that can be replaced with things like a router end or orbital sander end. Kind of a cool idea, but I just want it to be a drill so I probably could have saved a little money and got just a typical drill. Other than that it works very well and I am happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Black& Decker drill
customer_reviews.text: I owe many cordless drills from DeWalt to Hitachi drills. Don't get me wrong I still like my other drills they have lasted a very long time. This Black& Decker is so versatile it's like having well workshop on the go. it is very strong, very durable, Easy to switch the heads back-and-forth. I have arthritis in my hands so. Does this drill hold up to my other drills? YES!!!
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Matrix fits all your old Craftsman bolt-on.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill for the simple fact, that all the Craftsman components fit the Black and Decker matrix. I have had the Craftsman bolt-on for about 12 years and the main motor part buttons were failing. The motor was still strong. So that's why I bought the Matrix. I really enjoy this tool. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Craftsman Snap On Replacement
customer_reviews.text: My Craftsman Snap On drill finally failed after many years. Had a lot of attachments for it. Discovered this drill is basically the same thing. Very happy that I can continue to use all my attachments on this drill. Batteries are the same too, so I now have 3.
customer_reviews.author: Brett E. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great drill, excited about whole Matrix system
customer_reviews.text: Great for little jobs around the house. Don't have any major projects yet to test it on heavier tasks, but it's handled drilling wood and some light concrete at the apartment. Live in a small apartment and anything to reduce clutter and space required is worth it. Maybe I've traded off some performance, but this thing is handling everything it needs to (and then some) in our little place. Very happy work this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: The matrix drill has been updated, it now has a light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement of the same model that just stopped working. They added a light. It's a great tool, I already had attachments, and it works great. My suggestion buy an extended life battery. I bought a better battery, and the tools lasts longer, and feels strong when using the jigsaw for cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Quality Drill
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few weeks now, have put together a lot of projects and repairs, gets the job done every single time and has really great battery life, I went about a good couple days using it, right out the box, before it needed a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Worry it
customer_reviews.text: Iv owned a Black and Decker drill before 2nd hand bought it in Gargage sale and it was good until it got stolen at work . Anywho, got this bad boy and excited to use around the house. It's good for house work and small projects. Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Fernando L.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I ordered by mistake the B&D 20 volt max cordless drill driver but it turned out as my daughter needed it so I ordered and received the 20 volt drill driver matrix that has several attachments (not included) that I can buy and use as I see my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dean George

customer_reviews.title: Have had this several months, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this drill super often (live in an apartment), but I think I've charged the battery once(?) since I've bought it several months ago. Works great, much more powerful than my smaller powered screwdriver. Lightweight, easy to use, loving the battery life.
customer_reviews.author: ayoa2

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for daily use!!
customer_reviews.text: Great versatile tool! I have most of the matrix attachments and another body to have two tools at the same time. Great tool set to have for someone looking for versatility and doesn’t take a lot of space versus having the individual tools!
customer_reviews.author: Mihai Marin

customer_reviews.title: has led light when using, works with previous matrix attachments.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good the led did come in handy on first use, the led light always turns on when triggered is pulled and that is only way to turn it on, there is no way to turn it off if you dont want want it on when pulling trigger, nothing much different from previous models except for design and bit holder is on top now because of where the led is, older matrix attachments do fit this new model as well as previous model batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: interchangeable heads
customer_reviews.text: Snap change from a drill / screwdriver to a small circular saw or a jigsaw in a few seconds. I probably wont use the little saw attachments very often as I have larger circular saw and reciprocating saw at home but it's a cool tool to take along in the camper .
customer_reviews.author: RICHIE MONITEAU

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for one that burned up from excessive use. This one actually feels better than the previous model. I use it for general purposes, mostly household repairs. I love the multiple applications it serves.
customer_reviews.author: Zerocole

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my wife. I have the Craftsman version. Stuggled to find another Craftsman version for her, plus this one was so much cheaper and it is exactly the same as my Craftsman. She loves it. She is able to use all of my attachments with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mguberm0

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Drill for the price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new drill after my last cheapo drill died after three months. This drill seems to be a quality product. It doesn't include a lot of unnecessary equipment that some other drills do. I like the magnetic holder on top for a screwdriver bit. The batteries seem to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this. For a home owner remolding his entire house (ripped it to studs), I love this drill. This is the number 1 tool I've used. Drill works great, but I also bought the trim saw attachment. Love that as well. Since then I bought the impact driver and the sander attachment. Great buy if you're looking for something super economical and don't want to buy a million separate tools. No complaints. Except if you're looking to work for several hours at time, sometimes it runs out of battery. Either by a 2nd battery or recharge it if you're setting it down for several minutes to conserve battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge step up from the BD 18v single source I had before. It has way more power, the battery lasts much longer, and being able to swap out the chuck to make it an impact driver or sander is great (sold separately).
customer_reviews.author: Zach Langner

customer_reviews.title: The universal use of this tool is amazing! I have most of the attachments from CRAFTSMAN ...
customer_reviews.text: The universal use of this tool is amazing! I have most of the attachments from CRAFTSMAN BOLT-ON and BLACK+DECKER MATRIX model, which are completely compatible with each other! I have other 20v MAX products from B+D and all the batteries are compatible as well! No more unnecessary clutter of random tool batteries!
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate by this drill. Just be prepared  for the bills after
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing drill for the price. If you need a moderate powered drill this could be your soulmate. It also is capable of filling the shoes of Several Power tools as smaller scale. I’m so forgotten the reciprocating saw and the cut outs saw and the skill saw.. al work quite well
customer_reviews.author: erikisnothere

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: A nice drill at a good price. 20v Lithium is great. it's a bit on the heavy side, but not too bad. The interchangeable tools are great...you can get all sorts of different tools to put on the end of the unit. This unit comes w/ the drill/driver attachment, but they have routers, sanders, jigsaws, etc. A great option for someone that occasionally uses different tools, and doesn't need to buy each one independently.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Battery life was very good.
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive 20-volt battery-powered hand drill it has worked very well for me. We just took out 10 aluminum windows from our Florida room and put in 10 aluminum double pane windows. Use the drill a lot. Charging overnight was very easy. Overall a goodbye for the price!
customer_reviews.author: terry anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Tool-bag
customer_reviews.text: This drill is made of a hard lightweight plastic and seems to pack a punch. The drill is compatible with other Black + Decker attachments, which make very useful for other projects you might need to tackle in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Evans

customer_reviews.title: Love black and decker
customer_reviews.text: Perfect drill for me (a woman). I do most of my own repairs and projects and I needed a cordless that held a charge longer than the lightweight ones I have for miner repairs. This fits the bill without being too heavy. Love it. And it’s a black and decker
customer_reviews.author: Payson Taz

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: More power and battery life with the 20v. I have all the attachmemts and for a DIYer its a must have tool. The other option is to buy the corded drill. But the 20v battery option has been way more convenient and with 3 batteries i can work on my project's all day long while 1 battery charges
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Have used B &D drills for years and this one continues the quality I expect. I have problem with location of reverse button as I’m continually bumping it and putting droll in reverse when I don’t want it to be there.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Best drill I've ever used! I was wary about the light weight not being strong enough to handle the tough jobs but it has POWER and some. I had it drilling through concrete without a hitch. I was also nervous about the matrix part and switching out heads. My father always said that the more features, the more there is to break. But everything is made with high quality parts and I trust that I will be using this for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your tool box.
customer_reviews.text: This drill is easy to hold and use. And not too heavy. Perfect size! Not to mention a battery and charger comes with it. Score! !
customer_reviews.author: Miss Shaina

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: The battery dies quickly using some attachments so I recommend purchasing more batteries / fast charger if you plan on using it for consistently for a long period of time. It is extremely light, durable, with a good grip. The light illuminates dark areas nicely however the magnetic bit holder is nothing to brag about. The bit falls off when using some attachments that cause intense vibrations. Easy and simple to change attachments from a large selection. I love that the battery can also be used in other Black and Decker tools. Perfect for DIYs / small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive drill!
customer_reviews.text: While is not a dewalt, for almost half the price this drill is worth the money. It has a good battery life great fit and finish and I love the detachable head! This drill has already drilled plenty of holes and I've only had it for about a week and I can tell you it's worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Melvin james

customer_reviews.title: Love these tools
customer_reviews.text: Love these tools!!!!! I use this tool the most out of all of my other hand tools because it is so many tools in one I'm going on my third head right now because I wear them out. I also just purchased a corded matrix for a back up so that when I do wear this one out I'll have a back up until I get a new battery one.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mike....NY

customer_reviews.title: Super Compact and convenient tool kit
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why Matrix is no longer made by Black & Decker. I have had mine several years and have yet to be disappointed. I purchase the extra drill just to have one in case they totally become unavailable. It is so lightweight inconvenient and offers so many attachment options for so much less than others on the market
customer_reviews.author: Richard T

customer_reviews.title: Better than the same strength craftsman
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son n law with the 1/4" driver head to use in his motorcycle and atv shop and I'm surprised at the power and torque this has. It is stronger than my 19 volt craftsman 1/4" driver and the battery lasts longer than the craftsman lithium battery
customer_reviews.author: Gmanf61nc

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept
customer_reviews.text: I have 8 different tool "heads" that I keep in an ordinary small tool box and I can grab one tool box and have 8 different power tools in one hand. This is my 2nd tool, liked the 1st one so much I bought a 2nd!
customer_reviews.author: Den M

customer_reviews.title: This tool is nice and strong, and keeps on going!
customer_reviews.text: Came fully charged! Great price compared to other stores! After using it to screw in 80 4”screws. My partner set it by the door to use the next day. I asked if didn’t she think she needed to charge it over night before using it again? She picked it up pressed on the trigger and it had a strong charge, sounded like when she used it the day before, awesome!
customer_reviews.author: LisaB

customer_reviews.title: BD matrix
customer_reviews.text: Just as you think it works.... good. BD used to be the cheap throw away brand but top of the heap in my opinion. Nice innovation with the matrix system allows you to likely have the fix in your bag of BD matrix tools. I have most attachments. This bag goes with me every time. BD makes a circular saw too but not as attachment. Wish I had that but have robi circular & miter that I have to take with me also. I would dump the robi but BD doesn't make a miter.... at least not yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and good for the price and really handy...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best ideas in screw guns they have ever came up with. I bought one for my husband for an anniversary with 12 different accessories.. At first he bitched but after he tried it and used it once we own three. 1 he keeps with him for jobs, one in his shop and one for me... It is really nice to be able to just change the parts to do a job instead of having 15 different tools. Just take one off and attach the one you want...
customer_reviews.author: Bla Bla

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want a drill that works for 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Barely one month of light use and this drill is already broken. Like the last Black & Decker drill I purchased, the trigger works only intermittently. Save yourself the frustration and stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: These batteries live forever, best drill so far and all the atchaments are good except the saw, too much torque on the drill, don't like the burn smell.
customer_reviews.author: Bode 1

customer_reviews.title: ejb
customer_reviews.text: This drill is very innovative with the interchangeable heads. The problem is the motor. I was building a deck and the motor over heated and stared to smoke just from drilling holes and putting in 3 1/2 inch decking screws. They would have a great product if they would put in a better motor. This is the second one that did this for me with light to moderate work. I would not recommend this unless you are using it for light work for short periods.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Bessert

customer_reviews.title: Best drill I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Having gone through plenty of "lithium ion" battery drill's - this is the one to out last them all. Very happy with this drill. Very useful and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and versatile enough to blow the mind.
customer_reviews.text: And now I have one tool and an arsenal of accessories I can use to be the best DIYer on the block! *my matrix brings all the DIYers to the yard*
customer_reviews.author: Jessanne

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, battery lasts a long time with strength, don't plan on buy the impact driver attachment, as that was the only part that had bad reviews.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. W. Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill and the whole Matrix system! This drill is super solid and very powerful. The new Max lithium system is such huge improvement over the old NiCad B&Ds that you can't even really compare them. The tools are powerful and the batteries last much longer and don't seem to gradually fail the way the old ones did. The attachments all work really well and are very solid. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: ctx1050

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: Bought and started project and didn't make it through. Just bought a couple of months ago along with several attachments. regretting purchase
customer_reviews.author: james Byrge

customer_reviews.title: Good for everyday home use.
customer_reviews.text: Great drill from Black and Decker. The interchangeable head saves space and is innovative. Would recommend for easy to medium tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: This drill seems to be ok but the problem I ...
customer_reviews.text: This drill seems to be ok but the problem I have is the battery size. My weed trimmer has 2.0 mAh batteries this drill came with 1.5 mAh. I asked the community about using the 2.0 mAh in this drill and almost everyone said it might run hot using 2.0 batteries in this drill. Well, I can't help but wonder if they solved the over heating on the previous model but sending it with smaller mAh battery and raising the price about $15.
customer_reviews.author: Den

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: Use 'em all the time; I've got two. Accessories are interesting too. Wish I could find one with a keyed chuck tho; sometimes bits slip despite being fully tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Steamboat Ed Haas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Matrix tool. After a number of years of faithful service the first one finally died. All my attachments (LOVE the circular saw attachment) still work perfectly on the new one. Love it. Best to buy an extra battery though
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P. McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work pretty well. I have not used it in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work pretty well. I have not used it in a heavy duty way but it puts screws into deck boards just fine and seems to hold up. We'll see after next spring when I finish the deck but it works well enough for the basic homeowner. No complaints. I also have a battery operated weed whip/edger and the batteries are interchangeable... both drill and weed whip are Black and Decker. I like both. They do the job I need.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to replace a bolt on driver which was made by sears
customer_reviews.text: If you have a bolt on unit then you know what I mean sears want over 2 hundred dollars to replace mine, as you can see great price for this one and it works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Stamberger

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 3 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for only 4 months and it completely stopped working. You pull the trigger the light comes on but not the drive on the grill. I'll contact the manufacturer to see what they'll do but this is probably not as good a product is was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: James D McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the Matrix flexibility. This is the second one I have purchased. It gets good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Rod J.

customer_reviews.title: If you plan on using it alot buy a better drill
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap and it works, dont expect anything else. The reason I dont really like it is it has a horrible speed control and will just stop if you squeeze the trigger too many times.
customer_reviews.author: Adam r

customer_reviews.title: Don’t put your spare bit on the weak magnet
customer_reviews.text: I like the drill but I hate the magnet that is supposed to hold your spare driver bit. Lost two spares in just a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Michael James Littlefield

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact this takes the same battery that the power drill does. It's sturdy but lightweight, works great. Glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Long

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Update.. Arrived on time. Works great so far. I have 2 attachments the saw. Sander & they work great for my use. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: DJL

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lightweight, long-lasting, flexible drill.
customer_reviews.text: This drill is AWESOME. I've had Dewalt and Craftsman over the years (this drill replacing a 19.2V Craftsman) and while apprehensive, this thing is great. A pleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R.

customer_reviews.title: Handy and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to handle the little jobs around the house. Easy to use, battery life is good for the jobs i have used it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement for Craftsman Bolt On modular system
customer_reviews.text: I worked at Sears and was very disappointed when they discontinued the Bolt On modular system because my dad and myself have all the heads for the Bolt On system. All of the heads fit right on the Matrix system perfectly. So if you need a new main driver unit, this works and all the parts fit to it. It is a lifesaver because my dad uses the different heads all the time to build things around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Senshi81

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile
customer_reviews.text: This is a great versatile product for light diy work.i got this as a backup to my original and have most of the attachments.I have used the original for many small projects over the last 6 years and it is still going strong. It’s also nice to be able to interchange the batteries between all my other B&D things.its not for heavy duty but for light stuff I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This one didn't last a year! 2 ND one but the last was 7 years old.
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill. I bought it to replace the old one. I had the old one I had for 7 years. But this one has not lasted a year!!! Very unhappy 😥😥😥
customer_reviews.author: justin hutchins

customer_reviews.title: Better than their CRAFTSMAN BOLT-ON
customer_reviews.text: Works as good or better than the CRAFTSMAN BOLT ON I had before it died, the lithium battery from it and all the attachments still running strong. Way cheaper than their craftsman brand and just as good so far. Detaches easier it seems too.
customer_reviews.author: Juriah

customer_reviews.title: Get it for the modularity
customer_reviews.text: The drive shaft is not as true as I would have liked. I just used the air hose accessory and it worked great. Now will try the sander on another project. It drills faster than my previous 20V B&D drill. I can use the old battery in this unit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gifford Hwa

customer_reviews.title: this old lady loves her first cordless drill!
customer_reviews.text: powerful, very easy to use, not heavy at all. husband had to twist torque dial to show me it wasn't stuck, as I wasn't turning it hard enough. doesn't need much, but dial doesn't slide around loosely, which is good.
customer_reviews.author: halfpoet

customer_reviews.title: Durability is a little lax
customer_reviews.text: Matrix System is a really good idea. However, 25 months is about the most the motor will last. I generall buy one a year.; This keeps 2 running fine.
customer_reviews.author: Wrong feedback please ignore

customer_reviews.title: Matrix is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I went with the matrix for all the options it allows me on a budget. Its a great system.
customer_reviews.author: macgyver46

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER 20V MAX Matrix Cordless Drill/Driver (BDCDMT120C)
product_meta.description: Style:with 1 batteryBlack + Decker 20v Max Matrix Drill/Driver is a part of the Matrix Quick Connect System. It has a powerful 20v MAX motor which provides enough power for a full range of applications & attachments, and a 3/8-inch chuck. It features a lithium ion battery - Always Ready, holds a charge up to 18 months. This drill/driver is compact and lightweight design that allows users to carry out drilling/driving tasks in confined spaces and with ease. Part of the 20V MAX System - A System that Demands Attention. Includes: (1) 20V MAX Power Unit, (1) Drill/Driver Attachment, (1) 20V MAX Lithium Ion Battery, (1) 20V MAX Charger, and (1) Double Ended Bit Tip.
feature_bullets: Powerful 20-volt max motor provides enough power for a full range of applications and attachments
Compact and lightweight design allows users to carry out drilling/driving tasks in confined spaces and with ease
Part of the 20-volt max system a system that demands attention
Included Components: (1) BDCDMT120 20V MAX* Power Unit, (1) BDCMTDD Drill/Driver Attachment, (1) 20V MAX* Lithium Ion Battery, (1) 20V MAX* Charger, (1) Double-ended Bit
Powerful 20v MAX Motor provides enough power for a full range of applications & attachments
Part of the 20V MAX System - A System that Demands Attention

specifications.Included Components: Black & Decker MATRIX 20V MAX Lithium Drill/Driver, Battery, User guide
